abstract: Baseball Roundup; St Louis Cardinals general manager John Mozeliak says team will take allegations that pitcher Tyler Dunnington left baseball because of homophobia seriously; other MLB news noted.
lead_paragraph: General Manager John Mozeliak said the team would take allegations that Tyler Dunnington, a minor league pitcher, left baseball because of homophobia “very seriously.”

headline.main: Cardinals Vow to Examine Gay Player’s Claims of Bias
headline.print_headline: Cardinals Vow to Examine Gay Player’s Claims of Bias

snippet: General Manager John Mozeliak said the team would take allegations that Tyler Dunnington, a minor league pitcher, left baseball because of homophobia “very seriously.”
